item.title: Custom Resource Definition
item.description: Custom Resource Definition Custom Resource Definition is the feature of kubernetes where it allows us to create custom resources which do not exist in kubernetes.

item.title: Metaclass
item.description: Metaclass type is the class which all classes derive. It is responsible for the creation for the class. Metaclasses are rarely used. If we want to customize creation of classes, we would need custom metaclass.

item.title: Create Class Dynamically
item.description: Classes are created using type() which takes three parameters, name, bases and namespace. type is metaclass which all classes derive.

item.title: kubectl convert
item.description: Convert resource file to different api version using kubectl convert command. This is a plugin that needs to be installed separately.

item.title: __init__ vs __new__ in Python
item.description: __new__ creates the class instance and __init__ setups the attributes on the instance. __new__ is called first and then __init__ is called where output of __new__ is given to __init__.

item.title: API Versions in Kubernetes APIs
item.description: There are mainly three types of API versions in kubernetes, v1 which is stable version, v1alpha1 and v1beta1.

item.title: Creating custom admission controllers
item.description: Custom admission controller Kubernetes provides us a way to create our custom admission controllers.
